interface.description:
This interface adds average values to the interface to which it is aggregated. In the case an interface contains two fields, one (the accumulated value) the integration over time of the other (the momentary value), only the momentary value is aggregated.
In the case there are multiple fields in the base interface, all fields can be aggregated, maintaining the same usage (required/optional) in the aggregated interface as in the original base interface.

sensorData.comment:
**Note**: In the table above, `%0%` represents the name of the corresponding field in the original base interface.
Example: The field `Energy` is the integration over time of the field `Power` in the interface [`urn:nfi:iot:hi:meter:electricity:1.0`](/HarmonizedInterfaces/meter/electricity-1.0.xml). The interface `urn:nfi:iot:hi:meter:electricity:statistics:average:1.0` therefore, must thus include the field `Power, Average`.
